headline: Good company with good values
pros: Long history and great name recognition.
cons: Controversial employees get rewarded and promoted which confuses other employess

headline: Something has to give
pros: Great benefits. Not too many companies offer pension plans. Good health is encouraged through their Life Force program which offers discounts on health insurance premiums based on how healthy you are. Part time employees receive the same health coverage.
cons: Low staffing levels. No float staff to cover vacations, training or if someone calls out sick. Makes it very difficult to get the needed training to move up, and management seems to discourage or take offense if you request to apply for a higher position within the company.

headline: My experience has been positive. I have been able to work while finishing my degree. They are fairly flexible.
pros: More vacation days the longer you work. 100% 401k match up to 6%. Pension plan.
cons: Easy to become Complacent and Non competitive salary

headline: Terrible working in branches
pros: Life force health insurance and good training programs for your job.
cons: Financial Center Leader, Branch Manager, Market Leader.  Depleted branch staff, heavy sales goals, cold call nights, sales. They laid off several jobs over the summer 2013 so check the reviews since then. Its resulted in poor customer service and 60 hour work weeks.   If you're in the branches, its all about product pushing and sales goals just like any other big bank. They increased fees on customers rather than updating loan policy to generate income. Basically, I think BB&T is good to work for if your in the back office, but its difficult if your in a client facing position in the branches because you have limited staff and you have no authority to make decisions.

headline: Super job manager toilets ANC facilities
pros: Funky happy Sith job awsome
cons: Too much money yeah alright for life

headline: Excellent Benefits
pros: 401K match is 6%, Great healthcare options, Still have a pension!!!!  Good vacation/sick time.  Very good values and ethics at work here, despite the good old boy system
cons: BB&T does require a sabatical each year, so it uses some of your vacation time, but this is good and bad.  There is a good old boy system at work, and to get ahead you really have to get in it.

headline: Previous Employee
pros: Good benefits and work life balance
cons: Don't like to promote within. Understaffed and if you call out sick management gives you a hard time.

headline: Bank Teller
pros: Meet new people everyday. Learn how to manage money.
cons: Rude clients. Have to be quiet despite being cussed out.

headline: Great Employer
pros: Big bank, small community bank feel
cons: Need more career advancement opportunities

headline: Ic
pros: Easy to get in the program.
cons: No team work at the branch level.

headline: Good base salary, poor incentive program
pros:
Good base salary and work/life balance
Great Training
cons:
Poor Incentive Program
Lack of Leadership at the Top
Promotions only given to LDP graduates

headline: Great workplace to grow and be fulfilled.
pros: Great core values and senior leadership reinforces those values.  Conservative nature makes it a strong and stable institution.  Continued growth and they provide plenty of training and learning for every single employee.
cons: Sometimes BB&T is seen as a negative bank due to the conservative nature.  Competitors will be more aggressive than BB&T.

headline: BB&T was a product driven, competitive work environment where it was difficult to  nurture the client relationship.
pros: The company was financially sound.
cons: The financial center managers were not held accountable for their branch's shortcomings.

headline: Good company, low salary
pros: Great work/life balance, paid time off/holidays, good health care, relatively good working environment
cons: culture of low work ethic, must put in a lot of time in company to move up, culture of tardiness and lateness

headline: Good place to work
pros: Good benefits and team-mates, overall a pretty good place to work.
cons: Not many advancement opportunities without relocation

headline: Decent job for someone in college but not for a career after college
pros:
- Good benefits
- Good people
- Easy work
cons:
- Takes a long time to advance in most case, it's a policy that you must be in a position for 18 months before you can would be considered for another role
- Moving to another region it is unlikely to be promoted and instead you must stay at the same level or take a demotion
- A teller with a BS in Bus. Admin with < 3.0 GPA will find it next to impossible to advance beyond that position for this company within a year

headline: territory is everything
pros: nice people, a lot of flexibility with your schedule, newbies without licenses are given a lot of leeway
cons: you will only be as good as the referrals that you receive, you will be micromanaged to death by trade review, you don't really advise much, nor will you grow into a well-rounded advisor

headline: Completely what I did NOT expect
pros: The hours are great. I work with some coworkers that I really enjoy working with , and they are very helpful.
cons: Management in my department is horrible. Not much is kept confidential. A few of my  coworkers are some the most unprofessional coworkers I have ever worked with.

headline: Never good enough
pros: Had the best clients while there.
cons: No matter if you reach your goals you are told to do better without a thank you. Banking seems to be very deceptive. Its all about them making money no matter how they get it. They want you to put clients in products they don't really need so they have their claws in them and it makes it harder for client to switch banks.

headline: ETL developer
pros: Flexibility is there overall in work environment. Management is lineant in terms of work life balance.
cons: I see level of commubnication is broken, there is no chain of commmand with out side IBM in place. IT is really confusing for any one who joins here to get their deliverables met and use their full potential. Deliverables are not clearly defined and there is is no supprt as there is no communication invloved at any level.

headline: Great Place to work for a Commercial Bank
pros: BB&T now has all the advantages of a large commercial bank while still trying to maintain a community bank reputation.
cons: BB&T now has many of the disadvantages of a large commerical bank and is quickly losing that personal feel that has always been it's main calling card and primary advantage in the market place.

headline: too large and nobody knows what anyone else is doing
pros: great employee benefits and nice colleagues
cons: too much doubling up of work because various departments ask for the same material weeks apart.

headline: Lots of Opportunity
pros: Strong Company, Fair and Equitable. Willing to work with my college schedule.
cons:
They drag their feet making hiring or promotion decisions.
They also don't seem very excited to move employees up unless you push.

headline: Very good, but could be better
pros: Good pay and part timers get benefits also.  Most of the people you run into are friendly and helpful.
cons: Too many politics.  WAY too much gossip and rumors.  Tend to understaff leaving only a couple people to handle a large load sometimes.

headline: Customer focused company
pros:
Challenging and interesting position, like the fact the company focus on "perfect client experience"
Good group of co-workers who try to do the best given the constraints of time and resources; found this across departments
Benefits are competitive, salary not as much.
Stable company.
cons:
Short sighted management - no long term, cohesive strategy.
Political - same people get opportunities and promotions - management doesn't know or utilize their staff to the best of their capabilities.
Longer you stay, further behind - new employees hired at higher levels and pay.

headline: Great Company to Work for
pros: I love BB&T because of their values, their Mission and their Vision. It's not only written in a book, but all employees can feel it in their daily routine.
cons: I m not sure I can find something negative to say about BBT.

headline: The Investment Counselor Position is a Dog with Frontline Immune Fleas
pros:
-Access to Bank Clients
-Lead lists
-Ability to leverage relationships within the branch to accelerate investment relationship
cons:
-Internal competition with Private Advisor, Wealth Group, Portfolio Manager and Scott & Stringfellow
-Branch employees have zero accountability to drive investment revenue
-Branch employees have no understanding or training in how to approach investment relationship opportunities
-Senior management doesn't care about the plight of the investment counselor
-Lack of wrap accounts, products and brokerage abilities
-High cost of products prices us out of many sophisticated clients
-Lack of financial planning software to present plans to clients
-Overall, a very Stone Age experience to investments and too much conflict internally leaves the investment counselor feeling like they're on an island that no one cares to visit.

headline: This is the worst experience of my 38 year career and I really regret accepting the position.
pros: It's a very large organized and efficient company. They are very customer focused and invest a great deal into info security and privacy.  The benefits and compensation are competitive.
cons: There is a philosophy that consistent overtime and weekend work is an acceptable standard. There is an extreme lack of esprit de corps.

headline: DECENT ATMOSPHERE
pros: This place was a good "college job."  The hours were part time but sometimes got very late into the night.  I was able to finish my degree.
cons: Upper management can sometimes be "secretive" or not as forthcoming about information and sometimes pull the old bait and switch on the information you did get from them.

headline: BB&T is A Great Place to work
pros: Challenging position with plenty of training opportunities.  Above average compensation and excellent benefits including 6% 401K match and Defined Benefit Pension Plan.  For the most part the people I work with are great.
cons: Like most companies these days they are taking advantage of the economy and not giving raises like they should.   Sometimes technical decisions are made by middle managers that don't have a clue.  They solicit advice and direction from the Sr. Engineers but often ignore it.

headline: ok in maryland
pros: pay rate, and good clients
cons: dc staffing and working in dc in general

headline: Truly a great company that provides benefits, opportunities, and develop their employees
pros:
*Ability to move up in the company
*Managers do try to coach and develop employees to perform at optimum level
*great benefits, pension, and 401k
cons:
*In the branches it is highly sales focused and some employees are not sales driven 
*Could be a lot more personal recognition to reward employees 
*So many branches in a market but everyone is competing for the small customer
*A lot of call nights/conferences to make weekly hours easily over 50+ hours and Saturday's

headline: Investment Counselor
pros: BBTIS is a subsidiary company of BB&T bank and has a great benefits package because of it.
cons:
- HIGHLY disorganized
- There does not appear to be any vision for the future, and are painfully stuck in the past
- Lacks respect as a business unit within BB&T
- Is forced to compete with BB&T's other investment subsidiary, Scott & Stringfellow without 
  having the respect resources vision, management or culture to truly be able to compete with
  Scott & Stringfellow.
- The corporate culture is one of fear, intimidation and distrust

headline: Exeptional company
pros: Family atmosphere, great work culture and absolutely wonderful bosses
cons: If you have to deal with visa hassles, immigration department does tend get lethargic, does not reply back sometimes to your questions. Training outside of the company is hard to come by. Also work from home options when you aboslutely need them are very limited

headline: Average Conservative Financial Company
pros:
This is a good place to learn a lot about business, processes, and business politics.  I sincerely mean that.  After working at BB&T and at other places without any processes, I have learned that there needs to be a balance (some but not too many, make sure you have the right ones).

BB&T offers decent business and leadership training.   I enjoyed many of the courses and learned a lot about myself.
cons:
These might have just been related to our area:
- Too many reorganizations.  Change the structure and let it be for at least 2 years.  You don't know if something is effective after only a year.
- Too many meetings. 
- Too many circular meetings which relates to
- No real direction.

For the company as a whole:
- Too much inter-department fighting and jealousy when the departments have a bit of overlap.
- Still too much of a "good-ole boys", conservative environment

headline: Bad Experience
pros: Good pay; ability to make decisions on your own
cons: Too much travel; too little training; disorganized on-boarding process

headline: One of the best financial institutions to work for in the USA.
pros: Having worked in Banking for over 25 years, BB&T has the best culture and environment ever.  The company prides itself on family values whereas everyone genuinely likes working in their jobs and it shows in their contributions to the Bank.  Cut throat ugly competitiveness is not accepted.
cons: The only real weakness I see for this highly profitable, large regional NC based bank is lack of technology in the business units.  BB&T is addressing this shortcoming by slowly enhancing its IT Department and adding more systems that provide input to LOB decision-makers.

headline: I joined BB&T and the experience has been wonderful.
pros:
Strength and Stability of the organization
Culture- very focused on employee development
cons: I tried hard to think of at least one reason and was not able to come up with one.

headline: Best Bank in Town? - it could be
pros:
Values-based culture
Good people, collegial atmosphere
Client-centric
cons:
Expense control has become the official sport; Focus is on the very short term
All hiring decisions (including replacements of existing personnel must be approved by Executive Management
Technology spend (website, CRM) is inadequate for a firm this size

headline: Not a good company to work for at all. Minorities are not given the same opportunity!
pros: Good benefits for the family
cons: No career opportunity for growth!

headline: Excellent company overall
pros: BB&T offers their employees exceptional benefits, with many opportunities to move up. They are value driven, and want to keep their employees and clients as happy as possible. I had a great experience working for them.
cons: It's a big corporation, which can be a negative for some people. They are out for the benefit of the company, and if you don't want to work, they will find someone who will. Not really a negative unless you want to slack off. My only complaint is the constant push for sales. It's understandable, given the nature of the business, but can sometimes be overwhelming on slow weeks...

headline: BB&T is a great company with high standards.
pros: BB&T pays well, and offers continuing training and education.  They also offer benefits to part time employees.
cons: Branches are staffed too lean making it difficult for the RB's, RT's, and FCL's to market the bank and its services.  Being too lean also doesn't promote client confidence.

headline: BB&T is a good company to start out.
pros: A company with Great values and benefits.
cons: While there is a clear path for Branch management; if you want to choose a career path of Operations and auditing you will need to know people in the upper management.

headline: Good Company
pros: Feels like small bank, great benefits
cons: Too many inconsistencies when making credit decisions

headline: Ultimately you're in control of your career
pros: Lots of upside opportunity if you perform.  Vast majority of employees embrace values of the organization.  If you want to truly advance, you must be highly productive which typically means you must work hard - no handouts!
cons: Pay should be better for long time employees

headline: Liar,Liar
pros: Insurance is great but expensive
cons: North Florida retail management will lie as often as needed to make them selves look good. We were told repeatedly that no one was in danger of losing their job. Yet, several people did lose their positions and several were forced to move to unsuccessful branches. Was this an attempt to get them to leave the company? If you play the "good ole boy" game with the men you have a good job of being successful. Talk football, golf and hunting and all will be well.

headline: Dont waste your good years investing in a company that does not value or care about their people.
pros: You have a JOB, NOTE* not career.You are employed and are receiving income to take care of your family. There are worse jobs.
cons: Old school ways of managing,promoting,rewarding and retaining employees. NO diversity represented in executive management. Does not value women or minorities. The pay is not competitive and there is no work life balance. The managers all support one another even in their wrong and does not value or encourage open communication and does not value opinions that may differ from the majority. The company is run like a good old boy fraternity. Education is not valued or encouraged, regardless of education or experience individuals are rewarded for who they know.

headline: Very good company to work for
pros: Train all employees with sound principles of integrity, honesty, teamwork, goal setting, and striving for helping employees promote themselves.
cons: Tellers are stressed because they are expected to do more with less help.

headline: Good but scary place to work
pros: Work load is reasonable, easy to learn and cross-train. Loved getting to know clients. Very good benefits. My insurance for just me was free. I was actually paid $30 a month to have their insurance. A program called Life Force made that possible. I miss that more than anything else about the job. I made life-long friends there too, that's important.
cons: Micro managing!!! Hated being told what to do from people in Louisville. Lately they have "eliminated positions" like nobody's business. Teller is the only stable position in the company. As a teller I felt like I knew all there was to know after about two years. Made me lax and uncommitted because there were no opportunities to advance.

headline: Great values, corporate culture, decent compensation.
pros: Great values, corporate culture, decent compensation.
cons: Although a Fortune 500 company, not a national bank.

headline: Outstanding Employer
pros: Outstanding leadership. Conservative approach to business. Solid brand and long standing traditions.
cons: More opportunity available to LDP graduates. Technology lags in some areas.

headline: BB&T is a great company to work for.
pros: Great benefits for employees both new and senior.
cons: Can't think of any cons.

headline: Limited
pros: Large Regional Bank. Market is shrinking.
cons: We were acquired and the ability to have a decision maker speak with you about opportunities with the bank was difficult. No assistance from management.

headline: Very political but doable
pros: Decent benefits.  Moderate opportunity for advancement.
cons: Their IT environment is very political.  Groups will fight each other to me organization goals.

headline: Rewarding experience as a teller.
pros: Great employee benefits and work environment
cons: Economic downturn has visibly affected the bank.

headline: Culture has changed
pros: The local people in the branches
cons: The management and the centralizing of all processes.

headline: Mostly positive
pros: Great Pay and Benefit. Great coworkers (though that does depends on your branch/location). Good training program that is very beneficial to those with little to no experience in the field (college students/ newly grads)
cons: could be very stressful, lot of pressure for high referral performance

headline: It was ok
pros: Still has a pension, usually the job is easy
cons: Upper mgmt has little man syndrome.

headline: Great Company
pros: Management is approachable. Very big on making sure you have a life outside of the company. Ability to advance in the company.
cons: Goals are not always adjusted properly to account for branch location. Bbt does not try to assist you when relocating. This is why I left the company.

headline: Former employee evaluation of company
pros:
The company has a  philosophy of not doing business with companies that practice eminent domain. 
The company offers a lot of training.
cons:
They began to alienate clientele by requiring high balances and fees in checking accounts during a time when a lot of people were already struggling to make ends meet. FMLA means nothing since you can be terminated for having to leave to care for a child covered under FMLA. 
A lot of cliques. If you're not part of one then you may have issues. Even if your manager feels that you are ready for the next step in your career path, you can bet there is someone around who is trying to prevent that from happening. Yet, there are others being promoted with less experience.

headline: Relationship Banker
pros: Good hours and good people to work with
cons: Won't let you work overtime and poor pay

headline: Analyst
pros: Benefits and pay are competitive.
cons: Upper management does not seem to know or care what is going on for the average employee/manager.

headline: Satisfied with business practices
pros: Values, community bank feel with great benefits
cons: focusing more and more on sales and less on client

headline: Honored to be working for such a great company
pros: Benefits and values.  Family oriented company.
cons: With the economy the way it is opportunity is scarce.

headline: Great Company to work long term for and retire with if you are lucky to be working under a good manager.
pros: Great employees across the board in IT, competitive pay and great benefits.
cons: I worked for BB&T for 7yrs and absolutely loved 5 1/2 of them. The only reason I left is that I relocated to another state and was denied a transfer because the work that I do in higher tier IT prevented me from transferring with the company due to the data center locations. This of course was very shady because 100% of my job was done remotely from my desk and I did not need to visit any data centers since we had a team that worked at all data center locations. I was actually actively looking before I moved to another state beacuse of a POOR manager that slipped through the cracks of the hiring process. This manager was not liked across the board by many long tenured employees and it bothered me that so many of us found his blatantly obvious lack of management skills lacking while upper management was either blind to it or did not care. Some poor "mangers" somehow are hired for very high profile positions and are able to find a way to avoid upper management from noticing their lack of management skills. My first 6yrs there I had an amazing boss and would NEVER had considered leaving if he did not transfer to another department. BB&T is a great company and you need a certain personality to make the cut because they do not let people go often.

headline: Staid company full of middling talent
pros: Good 401(k) match, you won't get fired here, talented workers can really stand out, well-defined corporate culture.
cons: Poor technology, little understanding of the market outside of traditional core customers, inflexible work from home policy, no interest in innovation, 1970s-style employee benefits, sub-market pay. There's a tendency to denigrate the competition without studying them for best practices.  Facilities project a poor image to clients and associates. Management does not recognize that the workforce has changed- should rethink compensation and benefits to appeal to a younger, more talented crowd (no pension, better vacation, work from home, etc.)

headline: Very limited career opportunities
pros: The hours are bankers hours. The 401K plan matches 6 percent and the attendance policy is very lax.
cons: No upward movement. Very little opportunity for advancement. Raises are 1 to 2 percent annually. Too much emphasis on the numbers.

headline: Strong company hitting hard times due to regulations and outside pressures
pros: The culture is a strong part of BB&T. They make a large investment in training and feedback. I had a great manager, who cared about me both personally and professionally. I always felt respected and supported from within the organization.
cons: The pressure of the banking industry affects all banks, especially large banks like BB&T. There are expected layoffs looming and some departments including commercial banking are feeling the squeeze. Work life balance in commercial and private banking can be very difficult, especially if you are seen as a top performer. Outside pressure causes the bank to be extremely cautious, which makes change slow and work hours inflexible.

headline: Not a lot of professional growth
pros: work/life balance; little travel (could be a con); flexibility in schedule; stable employment; great benefits for senior leadership
cons: little potential for career growth; pay is below average; benefits are average for untenured employees

headline: Relationship Banker
pros: Growth opportunities are available. Great appreciation and respect for employee with good training opportunities.
cons: Health Insurance cost for family is insanely high. You will pay a high premium for their health coverage; I paid over 800 monthly in health insurance for spouse and child with no preexisting conditions and overall good health. However, a program known as Lifeforce is available enabling you to lower premium based on only your individual health status. This plan does not qualify for other family members. If your single and healthy then BBT is a great company to work for.

headline: Great Place
pros: Wonderful people to work with
cons: Long days and little compensation

headline: Solid company, good senior leadership
pros: Pay is ok but negotiate up when you get an offer because raises are minimal.
cons:
Growth is minimal for non LDP grads

LDP doesn't like internal candidates; It does happen but its rare.

A lot of in fighting with some groups in the wealth division

headline: Its a circus to work for
pros: Vacation, sick days, holidays and pay are good
cons: Managers don't follow through on what they say, upper management is a joke and fellow employees can do whatever they want without recourse...a circus!

headline: Great Place if you are ready to settle and retire
pros: Organizational culture is fantastic and the employees are wonderful.  They have Loyal Clients
cons: No growth or shall I say slow growth.  I am ambitious and they really don't promote growth in the San Diego office.  Basically if you want an easy job to do til you are 65 this is the place I'd go to

headline: Very good company overall
pros: The upper management is very reception to conversation if you are a performer.  If not, I can't say the same.  The benefits are very good.  The hours are great, and the working environment is very good.
cons: The lower level management structure is not good.  Retail managers act in a manner consistent with call center managers.  Rewards are "dangled" to motivate staff with not much hope of achieving goals.  Coaching sessions are more like inquiry or interrogations.   The title of manager should lend to the assumption that the individual holding the title has the ability to effectively manage a staff.  Unfortunately that is not the case.  The branch manager, or FCL, (in my experience) does not typically have the ability to handle pressure or stress appropriately.  Thusly, the staff bears the weight.  Not good at all.

headline: It's ok
pros: Having Holidays off and friendliness of mid level management.
cons: Pay. stressfulness of adapting to the constant changes in policy's & procedures. no job security.

headline: Used to be a good culture that changed
pros: BB&T is one of the few financial institutions that has weathered the financial crisis relatively unscathed.  They have great stability and leadership at the top who understand the banking industry.  A pension as well as generous 401-k are great perks of working there.  I believe they are fair to the customers in most situations.  You can feel good about your job knowing that you have helped someone in some aspect of their financial life.  Most major initiatives I can see the logic in from a competitive standpoint.
cons: Over an eleven year tenure I could see that BBT always followed the footsteps of its rivals.  Wells (formerly Wachovia) and B of A would implement a major initiative BBT would evaluate and typically follow suit.  This is necessary from a competitive standpoint but doesn't make for the best work environment due to increased emphasis on the bottom-line with a decreased emphasis on quality of life.  Branch staff is usually overworked and underpaid.  It used to be banking was a relationship oriented business.  Not anymore.  Transactional in nature.  My particular experience is that after an 9 years as a top performer in various positions I was let go after I took a territory that was new and had no potential.  My manager didn't spend much time helping me and I would almost say didn't give a rip.  I was hired by his predecessor and I think he wanted to fill the position with someone more like him.  I expressed an interest in a transfer within the company but he wasn't willing to sign off.  If you are an investment counselor they treat you as a contract employee.  In retail positions they will typically work with you to help you out.  Graduates of their management program are almost untouchable as far as reductions.  I've seen many less than stellar talent get promoted over other more qualified individuals.  Most non-branch/non-production positions are in Winston with some in Wilson.  In addition banking isn't really a growth area now and probably won't be for quite some time.  If you're in a branch you better be comfortable on the phone.  People just don't come in to do banking anymore but you still have to drive revenue.

headline: Not the best or worst company.
pros: Good benefits and salary.  Stable company.
cons: Lack of direction from management.  Too many managers out for personal gain and not whats right for the company or employees.

headline: Great Company
pros: I retired from BB&T in 2010 after working for them for over 41 years.  They are a great financial institution with strong management who believes in their employees.  They have excellent benefits and great  career opportunities for those who are interested in advancement.
cons: Review of comparison salaries bank wide.

headline: Great People, not satisfied with job
pros: BB&T employs a plethora of great people that are value based and friendly
cons: BB&T has lower than normal salary compensation for its employees while at the same time having a less than robust benefits package unless you are a tenured employee

headline: New to the company and loving it
pros:
Better than average bank environment. 
Pension, 401k and wellness programs set it far above other employers
If you take care of yourself, the company pays you to have health insurance.
cons: Branches outside of the core market are expected to work without much name recognition. Word of mouth is key.

headline: Annual Review
pros:
Not pushy with sales
Great Manager
Promotes within
Very secure
Always growing
Great Benefits
cons:
BB&T needs to improve their pay scales
BB&T needs to update their technology.  I.E. Online Banking, ATM and office machines

headline: BB&T company
pros: Pay and benefits pay and benefits
cons: Old school culture old school culture

headline: High principles
pros: Very good health benefits. Smart goals compared to other intitutIons
cons: Hard to achieve sales goals

headline: Great Leadership Theory...   and potential to be great
pros: Love the job and may of the people.  Really believe in Senior Management and their vision for the company and it's future.  I would've been a loyal employee for life.
cons: MANY MANY depts have Senior level managers who are only looking out for their carreer and not what's best for the company or dept they are supposed to be leading.  Personally withnessed lieing, taking credit for others work, and general dislike of loyal employees who do their job but aren't considered "super stars" because they don't kiss up to people.  I stood up for my employees and my manager when a Senior level manager wanted to help get her fired.  I really felt a HUGE loyality to this company and ultimately was let down.  A few bad apples ruin it for everyone.   However i'm SO VERY thankful for the lessons I learned and will apply them to my next job and work environment.

headline: bb&t is a job like any other
pros: decent benefits for single people
cons: It is hard to get promoted.

headline: Miserable...
pros: loved all fellow co-workers, great networking opportunity through surrounding small business, plenty of opportunities for training.
cons: micro-managed by Branch Manager, robotic and phony scripts are given to the point of embarrassment.  no room for advancement, sales goals that are met are never appreciated.  The worst part was the assumption you have no life outside of work, you are walked on, expected to come in when called on weekends or vary your schedule at the drop of a dime, expected to work ten hour days with only 30 minute break multiple times a week.

headline: great family oriented place to work
pros: Great people to work with. Room for growth
cons: Training could be WAY better

headline: Over structured work enviroment
pros: Excellent benefits, strong financials with multiple business lines. Provides wide range of product and service offerings to customers.
cons: Siloed work environment. No decisions made at local level although they claim they model themselves as a community bank.  If you are a forward thinker don't expect to be heard with any degree of sincerity. Every aspect of the business is scripted with little room to integrate your own personality...robotic.

headline: Retail Banker
pros: Great company to build your network, Company remains true to its mission and values. Work-life balance is respected.
cons: Bottleneck in certain advancement opportunities, Management is hit or miss. Skeleton crew staffing structure is the norm.

headline: You will not get rich, but you will enjoy your working environment and company.
pros: Benefits, flexibility, fairness, balanced work environment, great corporate culture.
cons:
Lower salaries than compeition
Lack of upware movement opportunities

headline: Good company, depends on where you start at
pros: Sr Management does things to keep employees happy, such as giving you your birthday off.  Benefits are very good, especially for singles.
cons: The pay is so-so for the industry.  Biggest drawback is opportunities for growth, you may be told one thing at one point, but then something completely different.  Depends on the department, but from my experience and others I know, management that actually cares about personal employee growth versus how their review looks is harder and harder to find

headline: High pressure and never satisfied with your efforts!
pros: Give you leads thru relationship bankers, sometimes.
cons: Manager says I am here to help you but was really there presure you if you did not make monthly quota. The atmosphere of "What have you done for me lately" ! Manager  presure you to sell whatever to clients to make quota and doesn't care if it's good or not for client.

headline: Vacation & Benefits
pros: Good work - life balance and helpful training at BB&T University
cons: Company eliminated unpaid vacation in 2012 due to a lawsuit.  Unpaid vacation days not available.  Paid 10 days for many employees.   Assistant VP & VP get 15 paid days.  Senior VP get 20 days. You get more days for length of service - at 5 years & 10 years bonus vacation days. You get standard bank holidays (Christmas, New Year, Thanksgiving, etc).

headline: Wealth Solutions Center Advisor
pros: excellent company with great moral values. value every employee and their work/life balance, especially in the wealth division
cons: no cons since I have been here

headline: Leadership development
pros:
Great values, and a 
Positive work environment is always encouraged. Great teamwork with partners with flexible reviews
cons: negotiate pay before you accept the positio. Promotions aren't as often as before however secure the right compensation when moving up

headline: It was a good starting position
pros: Great work life balance. Some managers seemed to care.
cons: Political environment. If you do not suck-up, good luck getting promoted.

headline: Glad I am NOT working there any longer!
pros: Pay was competitive for my area and benefits were great.
cons:
Management has no clue. 
The hours were horrible. I could come in to work at 6:45 am and work until 3 pm and the next day my schedule might be noon until 6:15 pm! Majority of the time I worked 6 days a week. Only the head teller who made the schedule had off every Saturday and got the hours she wanted, the hours for all other tellers were unfair and ridiculous. 
Even as a top performer who won multiple awards I was only given an annual  raise of $0.23. Not even a quarter! 
Very stressful job and always short-staffed.

headline: loan adjustor  - collections
pros: none, hours are awful.... good luck finding the pros
cons: this job is mind numbing and the mangers and leadership will stab u in the back in a second. NEVER work at this place, you will HATE it. The disrespect in crazy.

headline: Good if you like being told exactly how to do your job.
pros: Good comp structure.  Nice core values. Although they are obsessed with culture.
cons: They're obsessed with their culture. .  Hey often joke about going to headquarters in NC to drink the cool aid. This is a good company for someone right out of college.  Not so good if you come over from another bank.  They have to promote from within because they constantly harp on their culture.

headline: Good Company, pay is less than others
pros: Good Values, sales culture is/was outstanding.  Currently has a pension.
cons: Conservate, sometimes not in a good way. Pay increases can be hard to come by.

headline: BB&T Overall
pros: An okay, semi-stable company - by perception.  BB&T has done good job of hiding what is really going on, smoking mirrors.  Only pro right now is they have good footprint.
cons: Senior Management has been with company so long, going from small bank to large bank, that they lack skills or knowledge to take BB&T to next level.  BB&T does not like to pay competitive salary and works hard not to pay due incentives.  (except Sr. Mgt makes sure their pockets are full)  Management pushes Hunt and Skin but swears they are relationship based bank, bologna.  BB&T runs off Tier 1 employees and has more than their share of Tier 2 and 3.  For some reason BB&T has stopped dancing with the one that brought them, getiing away from their knitting and actually going down roads that have already proved fatal to other peers.

headline: Best bank to work for
pros: Pay benefits bonuses lots of relevent training
cons: Don't have any right now

headline: Great Company to Work for
pros: They value their employees and never take advantage of them. I've been blessed with the co-workers and management I work with. Their is never a dull day at work; it is always productive. THey also offer great benefits.
cons: None, It is a great place to work at

headline: Okay job, very political.
pros:
Decent pay for position
Mostly friendly coworkers
cons: Very political, difficult to advance

headline: BB&T
pros: Great Professional Development System and Continue Education.
cons: A growing company still maintaining outdated technology.

headline: good company, bad managment
pros: A very secure job with a company who has been around for a long time.
cons: Bad management, no bankers hours ( 6:45 am until 7pm), very fast paced, not enough training and not enough help.

headline: Branch Banking and Trust Review
pros: Great Benefits and Great People
cons: Behind some other banks technologically

headline: Overall Positive
pros: Great leadership at the top with sincere desire to elevate the interests of all of it's stakeholders.  Also, very competitive benefits package.
cons: Advancement can be challenging and some of the mid-level management can be more of a barrier to progress than an enabler of it.

headline: Great place to bank and work.
pros: BB&T has a strong corporate culture. You  have access to executive management in which you can voice your suggestions on what is working and what is not. They also have a great model for parnter referrals.
cons: Some of the computer software and systems need enhancements and/or updated. Some of the computer software and systems need enhancements and/or updated. There are limited advancement opportunities in some of the newer markets which make it difficult to move up.

headline: Great experience
pros: Great pay and benefits and work environment
cons: If too many errors are incurred you will get fired.

headline: Coworkers always willing to help.
pros: The people you work with day to day and the clients.
cons: Unless hired into management promotion opportunities are bleak. It seems positions are mostley filled from outside applicants.

headline: Rewarding
pros: training good working environment time off resources products
cons:
work/life balance
little advancement opportunity
getting away from what customers need

headline: Very Clicky.  If you don't agree 100% with your manager you can forget moving up.
pros: Decent salary, mostly nice coworkers and good benefits.
cons: Very little room for growth.  They seem to prefer to hire externally than from within.  Next to impossible quotas to meet so it makes for a very stressful environment.

headline: Love the culture and benfits, but management is shady
pros: 401 k, insurance, pay is ok
cons: management works together in coming down on the little people.  If one manager does something unethical their management backs them 100%.  Leaving the little guys to fend for themselves.  Human Resources is a joke.  You report something being done to you and they help cover the unethical manager and come up with a plan to get you fired for reporting the incident.  Rarely have coverage when an employee is out sick you can count  on not having a lunch if you have overtime they will find a way to send you home or make you take a 2 hour lunch some other day. Micromanaging is an issue. Under educated people with no managment skills get hired off the streets mean while loyal employees that keep the company running and keep clientel coming back have no room for growth.

headline: Good company, but growing pains... politics, nepotism/cronyism in middle management
pros:
Great people that are client facing, and for the most part everyone is pleasant to work with.  Most people do what they need to do, and still embody the fact that the client is number one.  Senior management from NC is very committed to Texas. Lots of growth opportunities, and additionally people who are client facing still "own" the relationship and it garners a lot of respect from clients.  Also, for the commercial side, the segment ranges of deal size are very wide and thus you are not limited to certain sized deals.

Retail side has lots of fantastic people throughout the branches, and are second to none.
cons:
Middle management doesn't actively keep in tune with what their reports are doing, experiencing, or hold people accountable.  Justice is one of the key values of BB&T, and it seems as though often the wrong people get promotions because of political pulls in certain regions and top producers are do not receive incentives commensurate with their production.  It seems there is a large degree of cronyism in parts of the commercial bank because of tenure or relationship, and promotions are not always justified by actual production or behaviors congrument with long-term focused efforts.

Senior regional management seems to think that coaching to cross-selling report cards is an acceptable form of management, and has generally triumphed successful cross-selling more than closed aspects of revenue. Additionally, management does not hold under-performers accountable relative to their job grade, and inversely does not give enough appreciation to employees who go above and beyond the expectations. 

Leadership Development Program graduates seem to be getting most of the opportunities in taking management or commercial entry level jobs.

Great bank, but has been a little / regional community bank that needs to start acting more like a big-boy bank in terms of holding officers accountable for their goals and performance.

headline: Poor company culture
pros: There are few, really good people that work there. Plus, the pay was pretty good.
cons: The companies culture sucks! Way too beaucratic, and even childish at times. Everyone wants to tell you how to do your job even though they have no clue. Very old school, "thou shalt do what I say because I say so" metality of doing business. My personal experience included micromanaging, which I hate!

headline: Values and client driven
pros: High focus on client satisfaction, and adherance to responsible business practices as outlined in Vision, Mission and Values of the company.
cons: As the banks is growing, more aspects which were handled locally are being centralized, such as lending authority. This however is unavoidable once any bank grows past a certain size.

headline: Best Company i have worked for!!
pros: This bank truly values its employees.  I came from a large corporate bank who only cared about their bottom line.  This bank care about employees and their families and they do everything in their power to show their appreciation.  if you do your part for them they will reward you with competitive compensation as well as a generous benefit package.
cons: There are no cons to speak of.

headline: A Great Place to work.
pros: BB&T is a great place to work. The pay is great,Training is probably the best I have ever had,Support staff is great,For tellers the goals are very reasonable. Teller Appreciation gifts are a nice addition.
cons: Upper Management does not want to help you when you have a major problem and your Branch Manager cant help you. Regional level wants nothing to do with the branches.  Full time is almost impossible to get.

headline: I you are a robot and insensitive to bizzare behavior from supervisor and branch leader,  then this job is for you.
pros: The health benefits were a little above average, and the cost could be reduced by  adopting  a healthy lifestyle.
cons: Banking by the book.  Fee income was stressed.  Not possible to give a little to a regular, long term customer in the way of waived fees.  Immediate supervisor had a mental problem that management overlooked or was not aware of,  making the job very stressful.  Manager not a true Banker, a glorified sales person whose only job was to generate loans and new deposits. There was no consultative banking being practiced at this location.

headline: Over Worked, Under paid, short staffed!
pros: The only pro there is for me is the benefits, only because I'm single.
cons: I work in a branch in Central Florida, we are always short staffed.  We try to see if we can get more help, but we "don't qualify" for another person...what a joke!  So when you come to "The Best Bank in Town"...haha, you will be waiting a while for something that should take only minutes.  Most of the time, you will find only two people in a branch, talk about unprofessional. The policies are horrible, and when you ask for assistance from people, you never get the same answer from both parties.  There are so many inconsistencies as well.  The management is horrible!  I would never recommend this bank.  The pay is absolutely horrible, with short staffing and high expectations, the pay needs to be higher.  They also do not live up to the culture that is preached to every employee.

headline: Great Company to work for
pros:
Career Opportunity
Benefits
Numerous Locations
BB&T Training
BB&T University
cons:
There are a lot of bad leaders and managers
Women are underpaid and promoted less in some cases

headline: Branch Banking and Trust
pros: Always looking for people to hire, both Financial and Technical
cons: A lot of policing. Inside employees refer to BBT as Big Brother and Trust because they have people walk thru the offices and report to managment what thye see that they do not like or may not meet their standards like papers on the desk, chair not under desk after 5, not sitting correctlu in chair (feet to the side and not directlu in front) etc among other crazy communist things. The call centers seem to be the worst. After exceeding set high standards for numerous job requirements, get a 1% salary increase. Does not even pay for my gas and I have 2 degrees. . Stay away!!!

headline: BB&T
pros: The Company inself is solid, with the bottom line always a focus.
cons: The Central Virginia Leadership is comprised of the same type of person, gender, and age. There is no diversity and no decision making ability by the Area Managers.

headline: Teller
pros: Overall this is a great company. I would by the stock.
cons: However, if you are a teller it will take you 4 years minimum to move up just to teller manager. Managers are rude, and lacked any managerial skills or intelligence. They also push to sell sell sell!

headline: A great learning-filled experience with the legal department.
pros: Everyone at BB&T really seems to enjoy both their job and the fact that they work at BB&T.  The bank pride is palpable and contagious.  Everyone in the legal department had an open door policy and was welcoming and helpful throughout my time with them.  They immerse you immediately in interesting work and have you engaged with clients immediately.  I really enjoyed my experience at a very impressive bank.
cons: I have no cons to report.  The company is doing well and my experience was a great one.  I highly recommend this company.

headline: Great for customers, mediocre for employees
pros: great employee cc rate, some great clients, good benefits (minus vacation)
cons: regimented approach to sales, little room for advancement, low pay, little vacation (sabbatical required)

headline: Average bank
pros: BB&T still matches 6% on the 401k and employees are still eligible for a pension. As long as you are close to hitting your goals your superiors will leave you alone. They have decent training for lenders on how credit works. Still one of the last big banks to give lenders loan authority.
cons: Way behind the curve in technology which is very frustrating. Communication between leadership and the branches is nonexistent. The leadership has closed ears and do not listen to anyone that questions the why or how things are done.  Everyone is made to give  the same canned speech to clients and prospects...its embarrassing and clients will call you out on it. BB&T is so slow on communication and technology that you won't be able to see how you are doing in your yearly goals until June or July...that's pathetic. And your goals will change without  warning.

headline: IT ADS
pros: Excellent benefits, still offer a retirement package which most companies discontinued years ago
cons: Slow to make decisions, need to move quicker.

headline: It's ok
pros:
Opportunities are available .... if you know the right people and you look for them
Benefits
cons:
Slow in changing and moving forward with IT technologies
Good Old boy network  -  Hard for females to move up into IT Mgmt

headline: Not excited to got to work in the morning
pros: Good benefits package and a relaxed management team.  Not required or forced to work overtime.  Overall there is good training for the bank.
cons: One of the lowest paying banks in the industry.  Majority of the lenders do not know their clients and wait for someone else to figure it out for them.

headline: Avoid this Dead End Job at all costs.
pros: Steady paycheck. Free Parking and close to a intersection to avoid rush hour traffic.
cons: The department is run under a dictatorship by a snotty nose dictator at which all management is overstaffed while the rest of the department is understaffed. The ole saying "to many Chiefs and not enough Indians" applies directly to this department. The Management is in a clique at which they do as much as they can to demote and kill morale in the department so they can to avoid promotions or raises for any of the employees in the department. The department is highly Micro Managed which is the big downfall of the job. It has caused a HIGH turnover rate which seems to make management very happy. In the past few years they have not replaced any of the many that have left and just added extra overtime and more work to save the department money which many feel that the site may eventually be closed due to many departments in the building being shut down. Morale is very low and every employee does minimal to get by. In this position a employee can NOT work independently without a supervisor breathing down their backs which has caused a large portion of the department to go on FMLA for bogus medical excuses to get through the agony of the job at which they can show up to work whenever they want. When hired in the position I was told that 6 months are evening shifts and 6 months are day shifts. Which was a complete LIE. Overtime is mandatory each week so when working the so called day shift it then becomes evening shift as well. And mandatory to stay late each evening. Many employees complain that they are being worked to death and yet management could care less. In this department if you give advice on how to improve the job or help productivity you are shunned upon as for they are always right and you are wrong. There is also no room for advancement in the department and when applying for a another department all requests are always denied. I personally have worked here for a few years and am considered a top performer and only receive a 1% raise each year with no promotions or any hope for advancement and always being shot down for any advancement in the company. It appears BB&t prefers to promote from outside the company than inside. To sum it up avoid this job at all costs unless you are totally desperate for work and have no where else to work.

headline: You can find better opportunities elsewhere.
pros: Decent salary for a financial institution, but beware, negotiate a good starting salary because raises are 1% yearly. Benefits are really good, especially the medical insurance. Good thing because you will need to visit the doctor for stress. If you are based in Raleigh you will have it made because the chosen few sit there, those based in Wilson are forgotten and ignored.
cons: Management is by fear and intimidation. You can't really win....if you disagree with an idea you are branded as difficult, if you agree out of fear and it goes wrong, like you know it will, then you are at fault. The manager is never at fault. Promotions are based on the good old boy program. If you aren't part of the right crowd your career is doomed. Performance is not important, you can do really great things, but if you don't go fishing and golfing with management you will get no recognition....that is where most decisions are made. Massive amounts of micro-management by staff that do not even grasp the technical aspects of the staff they manage. The obvious talent is leaving the company in droves and staff is being replaced by contractors from India. HR protects management but will not offer any support to staff while harrassment and intimidation is rampant. You can only telecommute if you are in the right group, others managers refuse because they can't micro-manage remotely.

headline: Provided a community based work environment.  Also, very conservative in the way of doing business.
pros: Decisions made on a local level.
cons: Technology not abreast with the rest of the market.

headline: Just OK
pros: Excellent Benefits, Matching 401K up to 6%, great training program
cons: Relationship Banker is expected to know everything and refer every product for poor pay. Your incentives are unlimited but unless you are at a good branch, you will not get your incentive. People at branches in good areas consistently meet goals and are always recognized. All about the numbers and not your service even though the company pushes the "Perfect Client Experience" motto more than anything else.

headline: A decent place to work
pros:
Maintains a human touch while running a successful bank
Works to have employees maintain a genuine relation with clients
cons:
Management is very conservative with a bent toward making political statements to employees
Management thinks that it has a great relationship with employees which isn't always true.

headline: Horrible experience!
pros: They paid more on the hour than my previous employer.
cons: Horrible management and if they don't like you then they will try to get you fired even if they have to make something up on no evidence. All of this being done of course during your probationary period.

headline: Overall, the experience has been great
pros:
great mentors and managers who love to coach
great opportunity to grow through the company, as long as you perform and are willing to relocate
consistent values across footprint
cons: Compensation and incentives are not as competitive as other companies

headline: Female-Dominated Workplace Where The Abuse Goes To The Top
pros:
The starting salary was fair. 
Employees are pretty sedentary, not a lot of moving is required -- if that is a pro.
cons: I worked in Collections. With over 300 employees in my location -- and most of them female, workplace bullying was a HUGE issue and management did not care. BB&T does NOT respect diversity. Comments were constantly being made against homosexuals. During my training a woman from HR came and spoke with us, stating that our location has had problems with that kind of thing before and it would not be tolerated. BB&T also claims to have whistleblower protection but that means nothing! I was treated very badly by management after reporting hugely offensive comments that were allowed to be made and joked about. This is a competitive, female-dominated workplace and its extremely hostile -- not worth the salary whatsoever! Collections is also based in Lumberton, NC so that has a lot to do with the environment. I had 3 bosses, each more pretentious & unprofessional than the last. I ended up quitting. The supervisors are callous, bloated and the entire workplace is a huge joke. My time is worth more.

headline: Excellent benefits, horrible work ethics.
pros: Incredibly rewarding benefits package which emphasizes and rewards optimum health for all employees. They actually paid me extra to maintain good health.
cons: This company seems to not care much how an employee performs but caters to those who have been there for a long time period and can make it unfair for newer employees. I earned countless rewards for superior performance but was still treated like a piece of dirt. This company says they are "for employees" but they're not, at least in terms of work environment! I could sometimes be scheduled one day to open @6:45 am and work til 1pm yet the next day not come in til 1 or 2 pm and work until 6:30 pm. Schedule sucked and I almost always worked 6 days/week.

headline: pretty good place to work
pros: fair employer that provides good work environment.
cons: salary increases are typically weak.

headline: Great Place to Work At
pros:
Little work, clients are mostly the elderly, or from out of state.

Walk in traffic not as much as Chase, so you definitely have a lot of down time.

Great employees, great bank to work at that actually appreciates their employees and want to help clients
cons: Sales goals. But you will get that at every single bank.

headline: Great company to work for!
pros: Very employee oriented, have good benefits, and love to help in the community.
cons: They do have alot of regulations from the government they must comply with, sometimes it's hard keeping up with all the changes.

headline: Investment Counselor/Advisor - Bank Channel
pros: Great team approach and good automated back office systems made servicing multiple branches very manageable .  Very customer-centric culture... Perfect Client Experience mantra is a winner!
cons: Old School Sales Management... hit your quota or be replaced... churn and burn, baby!  Compensation plan for commissions could be more generous.

headline: Good Atmosphere, Friendly Management
pros: As above, a very supportive management and training structure that quickly responds to an employee's desire to learn and grow.  Also, their benefits package is quite good, their LifeForce wellness program can guide you on a path to health and if you meet those goals, your bi-weekly health insurance premiums become a small monetary bonus!  How many companies in this day and age PAY YOU to have health insurance and stay in shape?  Very, Very ethical sales structure that puts the client first in more than superficial ways.  All in all, a company run by decent people that has managed, through conservative risk management at all levels, to do pretty well in the recession and stay out of the news for sketchy lending behaviors.  Employees feel a sense of pride at working for a bank that is one of a very few "good guys" out there.
cons: They hire in at mid-point salaries but promote to minimums.  This makes it a GREAT place to start working at, but not a very satisfying company to grow with since months or years of effort towards another promotion typically lead to minuscule increases. (eg. 29k to 30k when a new hire would make 36k) This policy, which many companies seem to have- not just BB&T (which I can't quite understand) causes a weird makeup of long time, high performing employees making significantly less (15-20%)  than their new-hire colleagues.  Note- all this is in reference to retail side.

headline: Good benefits
pros: 40 paid sick days, multiple paid vacation weeks
cons: This is a male dominated industry making it very difficult for females to advance.

headline: Feels like a sweat shop too often
pros: overtime is almost always available
cons: Reduced breaks and lunches every day! Continuous emails are sent out telling everyone to work harder so we can attempt have our breaks and lunches restored. call center management states that we are understaffed, forecasters state that we are at max staff allowed, continously getting incorrect information from supervisors then get held accountable for there mistake. Always being told that things are "in the works" to get better but nothing has changed for months!

headline: Overall a good place to work
pros: Great benefits, flexibility in working hours in non customer facing jobs,  in some jobs ability to work remotely
cons: Some managers tend to micro manage experienced personal too much.  Too much email that is not relative to company as whole is sent globally

headline: A big bank at its "best"...One acting opposite of the core values the bank advertises
pros: Most people that work at BB&T are very friendly and down to earth. A select few who completely subordinate personal interest to the bank have good career opportunities. You are guaranteed to be "promoted" if you stay long enough, regardless of work quality. BB&T offers very competitive benefits. Pay is mediocre.
cons: BB&T is incredibly inefficient. Wasteful spending abounds and spending in critical areas is anaemic. BB&T's compensation is not competitive. The entire bank is built with inefficient systems and an insider could see that the bank is built like a house of cards. Products are not competitive with competitors.

headline: part time teller at bb&T
pros: Benefits, people, work environment, salary, holidays off
cons: opportunities, different braches different rules, it's not consistent, a lot of regulations

headline: Company Review
pros: Great education and training programs.
cons:
People are not held accountable.
Retain the people who are not doing their jobs and let the people go that were.  
Human Resource Department is useless!
Great Culture and Values if they would just actually follow them!

headline: Slackers need not apply
pros: There is a branch on every corner so they try to get you close to home.
cons: As with all companies there is room for improvement, mostly middle management

headline: Working att BB&T
pros: Very well defined goals, practices and values. Take good care of the employees.
cons: Normal Banking Industry delusional views of the world. too many duplication of functions in IT, mid-management too large.

headline: Decent
pros: Laid back and reluctant to fire people
cons: Limited growth, you have to have good relations with upper people

headline: I have been very pleased with my job
pros: great company. look out for employees
cons: salary is lower than average

headline: Excellent Company!  Walks the walk.
pros: BB&T believes in its people.  There is a lot of opportunity for employees to advance and move around.  It is a respectful work environment with lots of thanks and kudos for doing your job.
cons: It is no frills.  This is a conservative bank with a lot of emphasis on cost optimization so there is no free coffee, no free water etc.  Employees must bone up for this.

headline: A good place to get a feel of the banking industry
pros: the management is pretty good
cons: the pay wasnt the best

headline: BB&T Opportunities
pros: The culture is friendly and welcoming.  Most employees have been at the company for a very long time.  The bank is reluctant to fire anyone, and works with employees when they make transitions.
cons: BB&T is not one of the highest paying firms in the industry.  The headquarters is in a very small town in North Carolina (Winston-Salem).

headline: Really dissapointed in how this company has changed
pros:
Excellent Benefits! One of the few companies who still give you a pension after 5 years of loyal service. No 90 day probation before health care, dental, etc. 
Job stability: If you are in a sales related role (which 90% of jobs are) you are pretty much safe as long as you do your job.
cons:
Everything is a secret. Nobody can give straight answers on when new employees will be hired, how long a situation will last, or what is being done to fix it.

Very slim on staff. They will work you to the bone...with NO overtime. Instead of one day off a week when working 6 days a week, you might come in at 9 and leave at 11...complete waste of time!

headline: Run the other way
pros: Decent benefits, good health Insurance
cons: Good Ol Boy network.....enough said.

headline: Great Company to work for
pros: Very good benefit package, thorough training, lots of incentives, great enviornment. Very comfortable workplace, value oriented company make sure employees convey the values the company is based on.
cons: Supervisors and Team Leads show favortism, this is not reflective of the company but rather the people that the company promote to these positions.

headline: BB&T has great values and an awesome mission... but they don't live by it... actions speak louder than words
pros:
- Benefits (pension and 401k)
- Great HR department
cons:
- Annual Performance plans 2% raise if a Very Good Performer?  PATHETIC
- Very low pay compared to other places
- Terrible management
- Managers are worked to death- averaged 12 hour days and worked Saturdays
- Conference calls- how about work smarter, not harder?  If you want sales performance, dont tie your employees up on a conference call that is pointless
- No recognition
- Managers who get recognized work in branches where everything gets handed to them
- Dont work for the retail side
- Senior management is selfish and wont promote you to a job you want if they want you to stay where you are.
- Some how confidential conversations go public and all of the employees find out
- managements lack of professionalism is hidden in the professional dress they want their employees to wear (panty hose?  Seriously?... its 90 degrees outside)... 
- Overall..... they need new management- its important for employees to see that you care about your family as much as you care about your job....

headline: Great benefit, great dream of bonus, but horrible at recognizing issues
pros: The benefits are expensive but expansive.  Many different options when it comes to retirement planning and insurance. Also competitive business products.
cons: If you don't mind working 6 days a week and 13 hour work days, please apply to this company. I used to work for this company and it was difficult to even have a home life outside of BB&T. They were not concerned about anything but the bottom line, with unattainable goals and ridiculous incentive plan. When I started I was intrigued by the rigorous training program and the opportunity to earn half my salary in bonuses. Well that was all I got, training and a dream. Brainwashed to learn the culture and expected to live it in my everyday life. Basically live for BB&T. So if you choose them, don't fall for the dreams they sell.

headline: OK
pros: The benefits are wonderful, and of course working 8:30-5:15 was amazing.  BB&T really is a great company, and they promote women really well on the retail side.  If you are a great performer you will make great incentives and they definitely notice.
cons: VERY male dominated.  Anyone with a salary about 50000 is a male.  Also BB&T pays horribly, I recently started with another bank making 10k more.  Also being a RB doesn't provide much opportunity for advancement in other banks because you won't have any credit experience.

headline: Good place to work, low recognition from management
pros:
Good company to work for
Good benefits for a bank
Good co workers
Work / Life balance
Product base is competitive
cons:
Company always expects more, never satisfied with your hard work.  
Management does not recognize accomplishments.
Corporate training is ineffective

headline: not a fit if that is what you are 'seeking'
pros: perhaps their overall compensation benefits...but it's a lie and joke to say the pay is 'competitive', if you negotiate a 'good' salary, you 'may' be fine, but trying to really go up professionally, or 'relying' on those 'annual raises' ...you will be waiting 10-20 years before you see that 'bump' in compensation
cons: you never 'catch up' with pay, when problems arise, it's more of a 'who to blame, what to blame, rather than what was the problem, or really finding out the root cause of the problem, it's a major - COVER YOUR OWN @$$ environment, see and hear backtracking, saying one thing one moment and something else the next minute...

headline: Not the great place it use to be to work
pros: BB&T provides excellent benefits.  The company is in a relatively strong financial position and growing.
cons: With the growth that has occurred lately, the client center focus that BB&T has been known for is now second to earnings and goals.  It is starting to feel very similar to many of the big banks.  The culture is changing from the top down.

headline: Challening
pros: BB&T offers great benefits. We still have a penison and 401k match.
cons: Sometimes the goals seem a little too difficult.

headline: OK pay, good management, decent products
pros:
Competent management
Consistent product offerings, never to conservative or crazy
Good environment
cons:
Pay structure
Amount of paperwork required for producing loan officers

headline: If you are looking into retail banking turn the other direction and run.
pros: Good public perception, strong capital levels, 6% 401k match, pension.
cons:
POOR technology base.
Relatively low salary and 2% or less annual increases (if you get one at all).
Branch managers and their employees are brainwashed and cannot successfully complete work load.
Service mentality has become overrun with sales first, sales second, service third.
Unrealistic goals.
Incredibly confusing goal structure, even the creators do not know what's going on most of the time.
Upper-level management suffers from a huge disconnect.
With record profits, many of us wonder where all the profits go to, it sure doesn't to go salaries of the front line employees.
Retail managers are annually reviewed/promoted by regional managers that visit branches maybe 8 times or less a year.
I work 50++ hours a week for a salary that is at least 20k lower than the average competitor.

headline: Good company to work for bad managers
pros: A few reasons are good benefits and stability.
cons: No advancement opportunities.  Managers have no interest in improving overall efficiency because they fear loosing their jobs! They have been there for 20+ years and are very resistant to innovation.

headline: If you're looking for growth, look elsewhere...
pros: Insurance and 401k benefits are great.
cons: No one on one coaching, reviews not received timely.  Growth opportunity is stunted and based on current pay.  Regardless if you further your education, growth will not happen unless you change companies.  Job duties do not translate to usable career skills.

headline: A great opportunity for anyone who is looking for job security and to work in a place with enjoyable people.
author_position: Business Loan Administration Credit Analyst I
pros: Laid back working enviroment. Everyone is working together to achieve the same goal. Good benefits that go along with industry. Strong senior management.
cons: Pay is below the industry average. Employees that have the "LDP" crediential are treated at a higher level than ones that don't.

headline: very sales oriented
pros: great benefits and health driven company
cons:
pushes sales 
no employee promoting with in

headline: BB&T is a strong company, but a bit behind the times.
author_position: Business Loan Administration Credit Analyst I
pros: It is a strong and stable company which takes care of the health of its employees.
cons:
BB&T believes in "total compensation" meaning your salary will not be as great as rival companies but your health and life benefits are stronger than many others.

Technology lags behind some competitors, many of our systems are unable to communicate effectively.

headline: Great place to work, but pay is not entirely competitive
pros:
Team environment has to be the best part of working at BB&T, main reason I have stayed as long as I have.
Pension is something few companies now participate in.
cons: Lack of communication in regards to goal.  We did not find out our Sales goals for 2011 until June of that year, and were unaware of how we finished the year until late January of 2012

headline: Fast paced, friendly environment.
pros: Benefits, beliefs, independent thinking, team work.
cons: Salary, compensation, time to attend school to further educate self, no where to go till someone retires.

headline: extremely closed with poor communication
pros: there are some tremendous people employed here, and a strong internal sense of accomplishment. The mid level management team is committed to success and there is a strong training program.
cons: EXTREMELY siloed and very poor communication. John Allison leaving was a severe lost. The  different channels do not function well together and senior management is a good old boys clib

headline: No regrets with plenty of opportunity to move up in your career.
pros: Work-life balance, good management, values employees.
cons: Systems and processes are slow.

headline: I was satisifed, it gave me some beginning experience in my career field.
pros: Friendly environment, good pay, good experience
cons: Wasn't full time so I didn't have benefits (this should be expected)

headline: Stable secure job with minimal opportunities
pros:
Secure career with very little layoffs
Comprehensive Benefits Plan, especially medical
Low Pressure environment 
Stability
Consistency
Good work life balance
cons:
Base Compensation is low relative to peers
 Outdated Technology especially systems
Too Complacent and satisfied with status quo
Not a visionary company

headline: I love the company and it's mission, but am very frustrated with the compensation.
pros:
Great values with a focus on client service 
Strive for good work/life balance
Stable employment
Excellent Sr Management
Very attainable production goals
Benefits
cons:
Fairness of compensation
Taking length of employment under consideration more than production when reviewing candidates for promotion
They don't reward highly productive staff more than average performers when it is time for a raise

headline: It's a learning experience, take the time to get to know your IRM partners and you'll do great
pros: They spend a lot of time in helping you develop, if your not comfortable calling clients, they will help you. Incentive for products sold is also nice. You also get recognized when you do something they feel will help other RB's
cons: It's hard to move up if you don't have a degree. Also if you're at a slow branch, you will be making lots of calls to get your sales up. If you have a bad manager, then Godspeed
